Package org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.staging

Class ForkedProcessorStep<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.staging.AbstractStep<T>
      • org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.staging.ForkedProcessorStep<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Parallelizable, Panicable, Step<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CalculateDenseNodesStep, RelationshipLinkStep
    public abstract class ForkedProcessorStep<T>
extends AbstractStep<T>
    Executes batches by multiple threads. Each threads only processes its own part, e.g. based on node id, of a batch such that all threads together fully processes the entire batch. This is a very useful technique when the code processing a batch uses data structures that aren't, or cannot trivially or efficiently be synchronized and access order, e.g. per node id, must be preserved. This is different from ProcessorStep which has ability of running multiple batches in parallel, each batch processed by one thread.

      • awaitAllCompleted

      • processors

        public int processors​(int delta)
        Description copied from interface: Parallelizable
        Change number of processors assigned to this Parallelizable. Accepts a delta, which may specify positive or negative value, even zero. This instances may have internal constraints in the number of processors, min or max, which may be assigned and so potentially the change will only be partially accepted or not at all. This is why this call returns the total number of processors this instance now has accepted after any effect of this call. Parallelizable is used in many call stacks where call delegation is predominant and so reducing number of methods to delegate is favored. This is why this method looks and functions like this, it can cater for incrementing, decrementing and even getting number of processors.
        Parameters:
        delta - number of processors to add or remove, i.e. negative or positive value. A value of zero will result in merely the current number of assigned processors to be returned.
        Returns:
        the number of assigned processors as a result this call.

      • receive

        public long receive​(long ticket,
                    T batch)
        Description copied from interface: Step
        Receives a batch from upstream, queues it for processing.
        Parameters:
        ticket - ticket associates with the batch. Tickets are generated by producing steps and must follow each batch all the way through a stage.
        batch - the batch object to queue for processing.
        Returns:
        how long it time (millis) was spent waiting for a spot in the queue.
